"Do we know who built the device?" Serious, I asked. "I'm not messing with anything if I don't know how it works."

"We looked into that." Serious, Nina said. "My grandmother was one of the people who made the device, with the help of a young woman named Finola Vimpir." She gulped. "She was a vampire from another universe, according to her stories."

"I think I've already met her." Wincing, I said. "We might need her help again." I knotted my jaws in decision. "Call your grandmother and see if she can come over. I'll have a talk with this Finola."

"Careful." Serious, Jo Jo warned. "If vampires are like what our stories tell..."

I gulped at that, then focused on the woman from my first jump and soon found myself again in her presence. Only this time, to my good or bad fortune, she was sitting behind a desk, with a tall and muscular man at her side. She turned to me, then frowned as the man fingered the hilt of a sidearm on a shoulder holster.

"We meet again, colleen." Flatly, she said.

I steeled myself and said, "We have no time for pleasantries... Finola Vimpir." That seemed to have caught her attention, so I continued. "The tenth level of hell is coming to both our worlds, and I need your help to stop it."

Finola was silent for a moment before she slowly rose to her feet. "Explain..."

"Criminals made use of a device to rob other universes of their riches." Serious, I explained. "Only it has weakened the device you and others had put in place, keeping our worlds apart...I was told you are among the only ones who knows how it works."

Finola sighed, raising a hand to her head. "I feared this." Shaking her head, she said. She looked at me, her eyes cold. "What is your name, colleen?"

"JJ Juspeczyk."

Finola nodded. "We have a version of you here... a quite annoying but useful self-proclaimed detective named Jay Jade, JJ for short." She frowned. "It will be interesting to see if she is jumping worlds, too."

"What do you mean?" Worried, I asked.

"My dear, the portal was opened the first time because meddling teens like yourself kept jumping to and fro, to meet other versions of themselves." Sternly, Finola said. "Consider yourself lucky that you are trying to close the device, and it was these criminals you spoke of who weakened it... otherwise..." She bared her fangs.
1111111111121111111211112112.title: Another jump.

11111111111211111112111121121.content:
"That seems to be a recurring theme." Wincing, I said. "We're all detectives."

"And, likely, all unable to keep your noses out of a mystery." Firmly, Finola countered. "How did these criminals get ahold of this device you spoke of?"

"Through blueprints stolen from our museum, according to my father's notes." Serious, I replied. I then briefly explained the chain of events and added, "Now, I seem to have the ability to hop between worlds, and my friend Jo Jo, from another universe, is stuck invisible, unless she concentrates on being visible."

Finola seemed slightly relieved. "That means that you two have become linked." More calmly, she said. "It creates a somewhat stable doorway, which will eventually close on its own, solving both of your problems... in theory, that is."

With that said, Finola turned to the man next to him. "Bring in Jay Jade. We need to determine just how bad this is, and quickly."

The man nodded, then left through an elevator. Twenty minutes later, he returned with a girl who looked much like me, only she was apparently a fan of early twenties detective stories, judging by the was she was dressed. She looked like a female version of Dick Tracy. "What mess are you cleaning up this time, Finola?" Frowning, Jay Jade demanded. "I'm in the middle of a mysterious robbery case."

"Let me guess..." Startling the girl, I said. "You are dealing with invisible robbers."

"Who are you...?" Surprised, Jay Jade demanded.

"I'm JJ Juspeczyk... from another universe." Serious, I explained. "If we do not stop these robbers soon, all hell will break loose."

"They are likely after the map fragments, just like in your world." Serious, Finola said. "I have the key piece here in my office."

"Then we set a trap." Nodding, Jay Jade said.

"I tried that and got caught." Bowing my head, I said. "That's why I can jump between worlds now."

"The devices are sensitive." Calmly, Finola said. "We will set a trap, but we will need more than the painting as bait."
11111111111211111112111121121.title: Meeting Jay Jade.

choices: I am trained by Mike Sutherland.
111111111112111111121111211211.content:
"You are not thinking of using us as bait, are you?" Nervous, Jay Jade demanded.

Finola grinned. "You overestimate your worth, colleen." Bemused, she said.

Jay Jade looked as if she had been insulted, only I caught the dry humor and smiled, which Finola noticed. "Are we in this plan you have?" Calmly, I asked.

Finola nodded. "This is an issue we cannot ignore." Serious, she replied. "Therefore, I will be staging a few tempting treasures for the thieves, and see if they take any of them to add to their growing collection."

"How will that stop them?" Wincing, I asked.

Jay Jade giggled. "Finola is in charge of confiscating cursed items used by vampires for their personal gain." Grinning, she explained. "It's actually how I first met her."

"You mean wit..." Startled, I asked.

"Not witches, those are a myth in this world." Firmly, Finola interrupted. "I am talking about items with superstitious roots which are widely sought out by the normals due to their history and stories."

"They also give clues of the Masquerade." More serious, Jay Jade added.

Finola nodded. "Once these thieves know who is guarding their treasure here, they will think twice before continuing or speaking of it."

"What will we be doing then?" curious, I asked.

"My... err... associate, Detective Mike Sutherland, will train you in the maintenance and protection of the gateway devices."

The man, Mike, nodded and slowly approached. "Listen carefully, girls." Darkly, he said. "You are in the big leagues now... fun and games are over."
111111111112111111121111211211.title: Finola's plan.

15.content:
Jessica Joanna "JJ" Juspeczyk: Main character; 17; podcaster; becomes invisible
Frank Juspeczyk: JJ's father; police detective; supports his daughter
Amelia Juspeczyk: JJ's mother; architect; works from home; homeschools JJ after she turns invisible
Frank "Frankie" Juspeczyk, Jr.: 14; JJ's brother
Grace Juspeczyk: 3; JJ's sister
Izzy Kessler: 17; JJ's friend; assists on JJ's podcast
Mina Johnson: 17; JJ's friend; grew up with her
Nick Connors: 17; JJ's boyfriend
Dr. Garrett: JJ's doctor; only adult outside the family trusted to know of JJ's invisibility
15.title: Cast of Characters

info.brief_description: JJ hasn't been seen lately. But she isn't missing: She's invisible.
info.description:
This is the story of JJ Juspeczyk, a teen podcaster who stuns her family and friends, and gives herself a pretty big shock, when she becomes invisible.

Of course, you gotta have rules:

1) No killing off the main character.
2) 1st person, past tense.
3) At least try to use good spelling and punctuation.
4) There should be a minimum of one paragraph per chapter.
5) Keep it PG-13. Nudity is fine. Strong language is okay, but don't overdo it. Sex is okay, but don't go into detail.
6) Check out my other interactives for a fuller idea of what to expect from me.

With that out of the way, let's get going.
info.pretty_title: If They Could See Me Now
